Qualifiers.title: Setbacks relative to easements
Qualifiers.scope: Determination of setback measurement reference lines on lots affected by certain easements.
applicability: Lots or yard edges encumbered by creek easements
Lots or yard edges encumbered by public street easements

exclusions.text: Most public utility easements do not affect setbacks.
exclusions.ambiguity_note: The qualifier 'most' is non-absolute and requires confirmation for specific cases.

references: Figure 16 (this page) – Setbacks: easements and sidewalks
Lot Size section – more information about creek and public street easements
Santa Clara Valley Water District – information regarding creek easements

Variables.name: easement_presence
Variables.description: Whether an easement encumbers any portion of the lot affecting a yard edge.
Variables.affects: Determines if setbacks are measured from the easement edge rather than the lot line.

Variables.name: easement_type
Variables.affects: Eligibility for measuring setbacks from the easement edge.
Variables.ambiguity_note: Public utility easements are stated to generally not affect setbacks; case-by-case verification may be required.

Constants.name: setback_reference_for_eligible_easements
Constants.description: Setbacks must be measured from the easement edge regardless of lot line location.

Conditions.if: easement_presence == true AND easement_type IN {'creek easement','public street easement'}
Conditions.then: Measure required setbacks from the edge of the easement instead of the lot line.

Exceptions.rule: Generally does not alter setback measurement reference (i.e., still from lot line).
Exceptions.ambiguity_note: Non-absolute; verify specific utility easement language.

cross_references.purpose: Illustrates setback measurement from easement edges.
Defines/locates creek and public street easements.

logical_dependencies: Accurate delineation of easement boundaries on a survey/site plan.
hierarchical: This rule supersedes default lot-line-based setbacks when eligible easements are present.

Qualifiers.title: Setbacks relative to sidewalks and public right-of-way
Qualifiers.scope: Determination of setback measurement reference lines where sidewalks and public rights-of-way are present.
applicability: Lots abutting public streets with sidewalks
Lots where the lot line may be in the street right-of-way
references: Figure 16 (this page) – Setbacks: easements and sidewalks
Lot Size section – information about public street easements/right-of-way
Development Center – for verification of right-of-way width/lot line location

Variables.name: lot_line_location_relative_to_street
allowed_values: behind sidewalk (private property line behind back of sidewalk)
in the middle of the street (within right-of-way)
Variables.affects: Determines reference line for setback measurement.
Variables.ambiguity_note: Exact location requires survey or official maps; sidewalk position is not a reliable indicator.

Variables.name: row_edge_location
Variables.description: Edge of the public street easement/right-of-way at the private property boundary.
Variables.affects: Used as setback reference when lot line lies within the street.

Variables.name: row_offset_between_sidewalk_edge_and_lot_line

possible_values.note: May be 0' or greater than 15', per note.

Variables.affects: Clarifies that the area between sidewalk edge and lot line is public right-of-way and not part of private lot.
Variables.ambiguity_note: Range not bounded above and is example-based; requires confirmation per site.

Constants.name: default_setback_reference_without_special_conditions
Constants.description: Setbacks are measured from lot lines regardless of sidewalk location.

Constants.name: conditional_setback_reference_when_lot_line_in_street
Constants.description: If the lot line is in the middle of the street, setbacks are measured from the ROW edge.

Constants.name: public_row_status_of_space_between_sidewalk_and_lot_line
Constants.description: The space between sidewalk edge and lot line belongs to public right-of-way.

Conditions.then: Measure required setbacks from the lot line, not from sidewalk.

Conditions.if: lot_line_location_relative_to_street == 'in the middle of the street (within right-of-way)'
Conditions.then: Measure required setbacks from the edge of the public street easement/right-of-way.

cross_references.purpose: Illustrates sidewalk vs. lot line and ROW edge measurement.
Further guidance on public street easements/right-of-way.

logical_dependencies: Verification of actual lot line and ROW boundaries via survey or official records.
Coordination with Development Center for ROW width confirmation.
hierarchical: This rule defines the default measurement baseline; superseded by easement-specific rules (see R1) when applicable.

Qualifiers.title: Setback/site plan determination for oddly shaped lots
Qualifiers.scope: Identification of proper site plan approach and setback interpretation for non-standard lot geometries.
applicability: Lots with more than four sides
references: Figure 17 (page 23) – Appropriate site plan methods for listed lot shapes

Variables.name: lot_shape_type
Variables.affects: Determines the applicable site plan convention and yard orientation.

Conditions.then: Apply the site plan conventions indicated in Figure 17 for setback and yard orientation determinations.
Conditions.dependency_note: Numeric setback values or exact yard delineations may be defined in Figure 17 or other sections, not provided on this page.

cross_references.purpose: Defines the appropriate site plan conventions for listed lot shapes.

logical_dependencies: Accurate classification of lot shape per survey/plat.
hierarchical: This rule directs how to interpret standard setback rules for non-standard geometries; it does not change base setback magnitudes unless specified elsewhere (see R4 for reductions).

Qualifiers.title: Reduced setbacks for flag and substandard corner lots
Qualifiers.scope: Allowance for reduced setbacks on certain smaller or oddly shaped lots.
applicability: Flag lots (front setback subject to reduction)
Substandard corner lots with lot width < 50 ft (street-side yard setback subject to reduction)

exclusions.text: Lots not meeting criteria (e.g., non-flag lots or corner lots with width >= 50 ft) are excluded from these specific reductions.

references: Figure 17 (page 23) – Examples of reduced setbacks: A (flag lot front setback), C (substandard corner lot street-side yard setback)

Variables.name: lot_type
Variables.affects: Determines which setback (front or street-side yard) may be reduced.

Variables.name: lot_width
Variables.affects: Eligibility for substandard corner lot reduction (threshold 50 ft).

Constants.name: substandard_corner_lot_width_threshold
Constants.description: Corner lots with width less than this value are eligible for street-side yard setback reduction.

Constants.name: setback_types_subject_to_reduction
value: street-side yard setback (substandard corner lots < 50 ft width)
Constants.description: Identifies which setback is reduced by lot type.

Conditions.then: Apply reduced front setback as specified in Figure 17A or applicable code.
Conditions.data_requirement: Obtain specific reduced distance from Figure 17A or governing ordinance; not provided on this page.

Conditions.then: Apply reduced street-side yard setback as specified in Figure 17C or applicable code.
Conditions.data_requirement: Obtain specific reduced distance from Figure 17C or governing ordinance; not provided on this page.

cross_references.purpose: Defines specific reduced front setback for flag lots.
Defines specific reduced street-side yard setback for substandard corner lots.

logical_dependencies: Base (unreduced) setback standards from the zoning district must be known to assess the extent of reduction.
Verification of lot width and corner status via survey/plat.
hierarchical: This rule modifies base setback standards conditionally for qualifying lot types.
